0P00000QLT.F.summary: Lâobjectif de gestion de lâOPCVM vise Ã  rÃ©aliser une performance supÃ©rieure Ã  lâIndice STOXX Europe Total Market Small EUR (CH0011440150), dividendes nets rÃ©investis, sur un horizon de placement supÃ©rieur Ã  5 ans, en diversifiant les investissements sur les diffÃ©rentes zones gÃ©ographiques mondiales au travers de placements qui intÃ¨grent de faÃ§on prÃ©pondÃ©rante des sociÃ©tÃ©s de petites et moyennes capitalisations, Ã©ligible au Plan dâEpargne en Actions.

0P000013CB.L.long_name: Montanaro European Smaller Companies Fund GBP Inc
0P000013CB.L.summary: The investment objective of the Fund is to outperform its Benchmark.
0P000013CB.L.manager_bio:
Charles Montanaro graduated with an honours degree in Anthropology from Durham University in 1976. He spent four years in industry before joining Merrill Lynch in 1980 as a private client broker in London. He joined Dean Witter Reynolds in 1984 and Drexel Burnham Lambert in 1987 as a Senior Vice President, where, in both cases, he was their top institutional broker in the UK, joining the high-yield bond department in 1989. In 1990, Charles joined MMG Patricof (now Apax Partners) as a Director of investment banking working with UK smaller companies.
In August 1991, he founded Montanaro to specialise in analysing and investing in quoted European smaller companies on behalf of leading institutions. He has since launched and managed several funds totalling over â¬1 billion and established a strong track record. In addition, he has served on the Boards of two public smaller companies. He was appointed a Director of the Montanaro European Smaller Companies plc on 12 January 2012.

0P000171Q7.F.summary: EQMC fund invest in relevant minority positions in European small & mid-cap listed coÂ´s applying a long term âhands onâ approach with strong value discipline and focusing on high quality assets generally exposed to global markets. ASN5.AS.manager_bio:
"Kathleen is an investment director in the European equities team responsible for pan-European small cap. 

Kathleen joined the group in 1997, where she covered Eastern Europe, the Middle East and Africa. She began covering European portfolios in 1999. Previously, Kathleen was an assistant director with Matheson Investment Management (part of the Jardine Matheson group) for nearly four years, with responsibility for investing in European markets. Kathleen also worked on the European equity team at Scottish Provident, having started her career with Edinburgh Fund Managers in 1990 as a European fund manager. 

Kathleen studied Commercial Management (Etudes de Solvay/IngÃ©nieur Commercial) at the University of Brussels from 1984 to 1989 (equivalent to a Masters degree). As a Belgian national, Kathleen is fluent in both Dutch and French. She is also fluent in German and has a basic knowledge of Spanish. Kathleen is an Associate of the CFA Society of the UK."

KORPT.AS.summary: The Fund employs a bottom-up investment process to construct a concentrated portfolio of shares in small European companies. The Fund primarily aims to use participation exemption (âdeelnemingsvrijstellingâ) and therefore the investments are usually at least 5% of the nominal paid-up capital of the company. The Fund strives to be an engaged shareholder in companies in which it participates. The Fund aims to generate a long-term total return of 10% on an annual basis, comprising net capital gains or losses plus dividend. The Shareholderâs return will comprise movements in the price of Shares in the Fund as well as dividends to be paid by the Fund, if any.
